speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: SCENE IV. Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, reading a letter, LEPIDUS, and their Train

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: You may see, Lepidus, and henceforth know,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: It is not Caesar's natural vice to hate

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Our great competitor: from Alexandria

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: This is the news: he fishes, drinks, and wastes

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: The lamps of night in revel; is not more man-like

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Than Cleopatra; nor the queen of Ptolemy

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: More womanly than he; hardly gave audience, or

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Vouchsafed to think he had partners: you shall find there

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: A man who is the abstract of all faults

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: That all men follow.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: I must not think there are

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Evils enow to darken all his goodness:

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: His faults in him seem as the spots of heaven,

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: More fiery by night's blackness; hereditary,

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Rather than purchased; what he cannot change,

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Than what he chooses.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: You are too indulgent. Let us grant, it is not

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Amiss to tumble on the bed of Ptolemy;

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: To give a kingdom for a mirth; to sit

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: And keep the turn of tippling with a slave;

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: To reel the streets at noon, and stand the buffet

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: With knaves that smell of sweat: say this

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: becomes him,--

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: As his composure must be rare indeed

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Whom these things cannot blemish,--yet must Antony

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: No way excuse his soils, when we do bear

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: So great weight in his lightness. If he fill'd

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: His vacancy with his voluptuousness,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Full surfeits, and the dryness of his bones,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Call on him for't: but to confound such time,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: That drums him from his sport, and speaks as loud

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: As his own state and ours,--'tis to be chid

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: As we rate boys, who, being mature in knowledge,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Pawn their experience to their present pleasure,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: And so rebel to judgment.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Enter a Messenger

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Here's more news.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Thy biddings have been done; and every hour,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Most noble Caesar, shalt thou have report

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: How 'tis abroad. Pompey is strong at sea;

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: And it appears he is beloved of those

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: That only have fear'd Caesar: to the ports

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: The discontents repair, and men's reports

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Give him much wrong'd.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: I should have known no less.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: It hath been taught us from the primal state,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: That he which is was wish'd until he were;

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: And the ebb'd man, ne'er loved till ne'er worth love,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Comes dear'd by being lack'd. This common body,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Like to a vagabond flag upon the stream,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Goes to and back, lackeying the varying tide,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: To rot itself with motion.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Caesar, I bring thee word,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Menecrates and Menas, famous pirates,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Make the sea serve them, which they ear and wound

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: With keels of every kind: many hot inroads

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: They make in Italy; the borders maritime

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Lack blood to think on't, and flush youth revolt:

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: No vessel can peep forth, but 'tis as soon

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Taken as seen; for Pompey's name strikes more

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Than could his war resisted.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Antony,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Leave thy lascivious wassails. When thou once

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Wast beaten from Modena, where thou slew'st

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Hirtius and Pansa, consuls, at thy heel

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Did famine follow; whom thou fought'st against,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Though daintily brought up, with patience more

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Than savages could suffer: thou didst drink

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: The stale of horses, and the gilded puddle

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Which beasts would cough at: thy palate then did deign

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: The roughest berry on the rudest hedge;

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Yea, like the stag, when snow the pasture sheets,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: The barks of trees thou browsed'st; on the Alps

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: It is reported thou didst eat strange flesh,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Which some did die to look on: and all this--

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: It wounds thine honour that I speak it now--

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Was borne so like a soldier, that thy cheek

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: So much as lank'd not.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: 'Tis pity of him.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Let his shames quickly

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Drive him to Rome: 'tis time we twain

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Did show ourselves i' the field; and to that end

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Assemble we immediate council: Pompey

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Thrives in our idleness.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: To-morrow, Caesar,

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: I shall be furnish'd to inform you rightly

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Both what by sea and land I can be able

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: To front this present time.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Till which encounter,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: It is my business too. Farewell.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Farewell, my lord: what you shall know meantime

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Of stirs abroad, I shall beseech you, sir,

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: To let me be partaker.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Doubt not, sir;

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: I knew it for my bond.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Exeunt
